creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
inscription:
Signature and Seals

Holding my fishing pole and reeling in the line, / I pour the remaining wine at the rough door. / The cold moon raises from the misty shore -- / So pure and serene that I forget to return home. (AS)
markings: URC, rectangular intaglio; LL edge, square intaglio; LL edge, square intaglio
medium: Hanging scroll, ink on mica paper
title: Poem at Age Eighty-Four
